intro: Trachyspermum trifoliatum, commonly known as Indian cumin or three-leaved cumin, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its branched, aromatic stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers and has trifoliate leaves, giving it its scientific name. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their pungent aroma and medicinal properties. Trachyspermum trifoliatum thrives in well-drained soil and prefers temperate climates.
